content: sleigh ride by cabinfour a sweetly cabled headband to keep you cosy while bundled up for sleigh rides in the snow materials one skein quince & co osprey 170 yds / 155 m design requires approximately 75 yds / 69 m total aran weight wool one us 9 / 5 5 mm 32 in circular needle one cable needle gauge 16 sts and 20 row = 4 in/10 cm in st st with us 9 directions cast on 20 sts with a provisional cast on you will be knitting flat throughout design row 1 rs sl1 knitwise k 3 p 3 k 6 p 3 k 4 row 2 ws sl 1 purlwise p 3 k 3 p 6 k 3 p 4 row 3 repeat row 1 row 4 repeat row 2 row 5 repeat row 1 row 6 repeat row 2 row 7 sl 1 knitwise k 3 p 3 c6b p 3 k 4 row 8 repeat row 2 repeat row 1 8 until your knitting measures approximately 4 inches less than your head circumference ending with a rs row 1 modeled design was knit to 19 inches in length to fit a 23 inch head circumference finishing with working sts on one needle remove provisional cast on and place live sts on second needle kitchener st your headband together with the rs facing out weave in ends gently block and enjoy wearing while sleigh riding in the snow glossary st st stockinette stitch st sts stitch es k knit p purl rs right side ws wrong side sl1 slip 1 st c6b place next 3 sts on cable needle leave at back of work k 3 k 3 from cable needle © cabinfour 2014 - pattern for personal use only please support deneisekemp@gmail com or cabinfour on ravelry
